history.narrative: Law 15-162, the “Enforced Leave Amendment Act of 2004”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 15-391, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on February 3, 2004, and March 2, 2004, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 18, 2004, it was assigned Act No. 15-397 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 15-162 became effective on May 18, 2004.
